column4: i want to reinstall ubuntu 12.04 and i have the DVD here , only i want to list all the app and software that i had in a text ?
dpkg -l
dpkg -l > foo.txt
: let me try
: thank you :)
np
rephrase
: i want to reinstall ubuntu
and what do you mean now with 'is there a stable release ...'?

i think you dont get it - 12.04 is the current stable - so you can either (not recommended) us some old ubuntu version - or (recommended) try to fix your issues instead of just doing a random reinstall
: okay
so was that crash reproduceable?
: when i restart i see for just glance a error ( i know it's error by the red color ) can you help me to find out what is that error ?
: when i restart i see for just glance a error ( i know it's error by the red color ) can you help me to find out what is that error ?
: are you there ?
you might check the output of dmesg
or just use a real boot-process without gui-hiding some relevant informations
so ask yourself again - why do you want to reinstall your comp?
: okay . where can i find dmesg
dmesg is a terminal command - grub controls your boot-paramter and controls like that if you are using a silent boot or whatever else
in general - try to focus on the channel - and not a single user inhere - and i still dont get why you want to reinstall at all... but i give up now anyways ...have other things to do
: sorry , i cancel the reinstall idea ( after you words ) now i want to fix the error only :)
: i execute the command "dmesg" where shall i but the output ?
: never mind
